product_name: Laura MercierMini Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur
summary: SummaryLaura Mercier's Mini Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur is infused with hyaluronic acid for comfortable, up to 16-hour wear and ultra-blurring power.
details: DetailsBenefitsInfused with ultra-blurring ingredients like amino acid & silica powders to blur away the look of pores, fine lines, and imperfectionsTotal shine control & zero photo flashbackKey IngredientsHyaluronic acid makes the powder comfortable for all skin types; ideal for dry skinAmino acid & silica powders create a soft-focus effect on fine lines, pores, and imperfectionsFormulated WithoutParabensPhthalatesMineral oilSulfates SLS & SLESFragranceFormaldehydesSiliconesItem 2616140How To UseTo achieve the Flawless Face, sprinkle a dime size amount of powder in the cap.Pick up the powder with the Velour Puff working powder into puff by folding and rubbing the halves together.Tap off excess on back of hand.Press puff onto skin using a rolling motion to marry product into skin and set makeup.The finishing step to achieving Laura's iconic Flawless Face, pair with your favorite Pure Canvas Primer and Laura Mercier Foundation or Tinted Moisturizer for her signature "no makeup, makeup" look.Velour Puff, Pure Canvas Primer, and Laura Mercier Foundation or Tinted Moisturizer each sold separately.Pro-Tips: For brightening for light to medium skin tones, apply Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur Tone-Up to the high points of the face (undereye, tops of cheek bones, chin, jawline, center of forehead). For medium-deep to deep skin tones, apply Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur Honey to the high points of the face to brighten.IngredientsTranslucent: Mica, Lauroyl Lysine, Zinc Stearate, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate, Silica, C13-15 Alkane, Ethylhexylglycerin, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Tocopherol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sorbic Acid. May Contain/Peut Contenir (+/-): Blue 1 Lake (Ci 42090), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491, Ci 77492, Ci 77499), Manganese Violet (Ci 77742), Red 7 (Ci 15850), Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Ultramarines (Ci 77007), Yellow 5 Lake (Ci 19140).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: To achieve the Flawless Face, sprinkle a dime size amount of powder in the cap.Pick up the powder with the Velour Puff working powder into puff by folding and rubbing the halves together.Tap off excess on back of hand.Press puff onto skin using a rolling motion to marry product into skin and set makeup.The finishing step to achieving Laura's iconic Flawless Face, pair with your favorite Pure Canvas Primer and Laura Mercier Foundation or Tinted Moisturizer for her signature "no makeup, makeup" look.Velour Puff, Pure Canvas Primer, and Laura Mercier Foundation or Tinted Moisturizer each sold separately.Pro-Tips: For brightening for light to medium skin tones, apply Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur Tone-Up to the high points of the face (undereye, tops of cheek bones, chin, jawline, center of forehead). For medium-deep to deep skin tones, apply Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur Honey to the high points of the face to brighten.
ingredients: Sorbic Acid. May Contain/Peut Contenir (+/-): Blue 1 Lake (Ci 42090)

reviews.headline: Flawless
reviews.comments:
The Laura Mercier Translucent Setting Powder truly lives up to the hype. It sets my makeup beautifully without looking cakey or heavy, and it leaves a smooth, soft-focus finish that blurs imperfections effortlessly. I especially love how it controls shine throughout the day without dulling my skin's natural glow.

It's incredibly lightweight and finely milled, so it never settles into fine lines or emphasizes texture. A little goes a long way, making the jar last for months, even with daily use. Whether I'm doing a full glam look or just setting a tinted moisturizer, this powder keeps everything in place.

reviews.headline: I LOVE THE FILTER EFFECT OF THIS POWDER
reviews.comments: The Translucent Loose Setting Powder Ultra-Blur leave a beautiful filter effect in my skin and I love it!! It feels like I dont have any powder in my face and people makes me compliments of how Beautiful and natural my skin looks. This is the best!!

reviews.headline: I've been using this product for over 2 years now
reviews.comments: Best setting powder on the market! It lasts all day and works well to blur impurities

reviews.headline: Obsessed ‚Äî this powder makes my skin look flawless all day!
reviews.comments: Absolutely love this powder! The Tone-Up Rose shade brightens my complexion while keeping my makeup in place all day. It feels so lightweight, doesn't clog pores, and I love that it's fragrance-free. A must-have in my routine!

reviews.headline: Translucent Powder
reviews.comments: I have used the translucent powder for about 1 year not even one complaint, my makeup doesn't become sloppy, doesn't make my skin break out and my makeup looks flawless

reviews.comments: They are an investment, but they are totally worth it. If you are looking for powders that seal, last, and maintain makeup with a professional finish, these are a must in any kit, both for personal use and for makeup artists.

reviews.headline: Smell is horrible
reviews.comments: I've used this product before, just finished my last one, that's why I ordered this new one. My last one had ZERO smell while this one had a scent of an attempt on maple syrup or something ‚Ä¶ and it does not set whatsoever ever! Maybe I got a bad one but returning it asap!!!!

reviews.headline: Amazing!!
reviews.comments: I love this setting powder specifically the ultra blur formula. It doesn't irritate my skin, a little bit goes a long way, and my make up looks flawless all day. I have normal-oily skin, and this stuff tackles shine without leaving my skin looking dry, too matte, or cakey.

reviews.headline: Pores be-gone‚ò∫Ô∏è
reviews.comments: The Laura Mercier Ultra Blur Setting Powder in the travel size impressed me with its lightweight, silky texture and soft-focus finish. It blurs pores and fine lines without looking cakey or dry, sets makeup beautifully, and still lets my natural glow show through. A little goes a long way, and it works well with both creams and liquids. After trying the mini, I'm definitely considering the full size.

reviews.headline: Blurring setting powder
reviews.comments: This powder is fantastic. Its luminous and blurring. The finished product is stunning. Its one of those products that is on the more high end but its always worth the extra money, plus a little goes a long way. It holds up after a long day, especially if your out in this heat.

reviews.headline: Worth every penny!
reviews.comments: As someone with combo/oily skin, I was hooked from the very first use of Laura Mercier's Loose Ultra Blur Setting Powder. My skin looks absolutely flawless when i put this on, my pores are blurred and my face has great oil control from this powder. I got the shade in Rose-Tone Up and it is the perfect pink that instantly brightens. This has taken my base to a whole different level!

reviews.headline: Great translucent powder!
reviews.comments:
Pros: super lightweight yet velvety texture; very easy to apply with brush; blends easily; long wearing

Cons: found the color to be a bit too light for me, had to buy the next darker shade and mix the two together to get a better color match. Please consider adding a color that's in between the darker two shades.

faceoff_positive.comments: As someone with a medium skin tone featuring warm olive undertones, I am always on the lookout for setting powders that not only complement my complexion but also provide a flawless finish. After discovering the Ultra-Blur Talc-Free Translucent Loose Setting Powder in Honey, I can confidently say it has become a staple in my makeup routine, surpassing many other products I've tried. The first thing that struck me about this powder is its lightweight texture. It feels almost weightless upon application, which is a significant plus for those who dread that chalky, heavy feeling that some setting powders can impart. The finely milled formula glides over the skin smoothly, allowing for seamless blending. I love how it effortlessly sets my foundation without accentuating any fine lines or texture on my skin‚Äîa strong point compared to other powders I've used. The shade of Honey is a perfect match for my warm, golden undertones. It's translucent enough not to alter the color of my foundation yet provides just the right amount of warmth to enhance my natural complexion. Unlike many other setting powders that leave a stark white or overly matte finish, this one illuminates my skin with a soft, blurred effect. The finish is natural and radiant, which I appreciate since I'm looking for a way to lock in my makeup while maintaining a healthy glow. One of my primary concerns with any setting powder is its ability to control oil while ensuring my makeup lasts throughout the day. Ultra-Blur does an impressive job in this department. I noticed that my makeup stayed in place for extended periods without needing touch-ups. The talc-free formula is gentler on my skin and doesn't clog my pores, so I can wear it comfortably all day without worrying about breakouts.
faceoff_positive.headline: Great Product with a Blurring Effect

faceoff_negative.comments: I received this product for free from Laura Mercier via Bzzagent in exchange for my honest review. I've been wanting to try this setting powder for the longest time. I'll start off with the positive. It helps with shine if you have oily skin. I used this over sunscreen and helped give me a matte finish without making me look like a ghost. I even used another layer of sunscreen later in the day over this product and was not left cakey which I was worried about. Overall very impressed with the formulation, specifically how it absorbs excess oil without drying me out or making me look cakey. What I don't like about it is how much it stings. This has vitamin c which I am sensitive to and I definitely had a reaction. Nothing terrible, but certainly uncomfortable. The other issue is that this product does not specify if it's  talc-free. I know it can show up as another name in ingredients so I'm worried about that. Overall, I would not recommend this to people with sensitive skin but would recommend this to people who can tolerate vitamin c and are prone to oiliness. I would also recommend that LC list "talc-free" on their product box if that is the case and if not consider launching a talc-free version because that is a deal breaker when purchasing makeup.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not for sensitive skin
